data.title: Great place for 🌭 loose meat hamburgers and more
data.text:
They never claim to serve healthy food, but they do serve good food. The staff is so friendly and the hot dogs, corn dogs, cheese fries and loose meat hamburgers are excellent! The cheese fries are, by far, the best in the area and it's nice quick diner service. You order at the counter, have a seat in a booth or at the counter and they will bring the food to you! You can also order to go if you are in a time crunch or just want to eat elsewhere!

The service is fast so if you need to be in and out for a lunch break, it's perfect! Like I said before, it's not healthy food so you probably don't want to go everyday, but it is delicious food!! It's nothing fancy, but one of my favorite places in the area! You won't be disappointed when you leave!

data.title: Great for easy take out goodies
data.text: Love the loose meat burgers. Also great tacos amd my grandson loves t he mini corn dogs. Worth a stop if you're looking for comfort food.

data.title: Good Food - Limited Seating
data.text: I can't lie, I was raised eating Madvek's hot dogs and I still, over 40 years later, stop by whenever I am remotely in the area.  I love the polish sausage and my husband loves just about anything they have.  It's a small place but it's SO GOOD STILL!!!

data.title: Incredible Polish
data.text: If you have not visited, you must try it if your palate is craving a Polish or Hamburger. Pretty good and will try again. A bit pricey but keep in mind it's not McDonald's.

data.title: Nice find during my trip
data.text: Found this place thanks to Trip Advisor during my return trip to home. Met my daughter and her husband for their trip to Chicago. We met Mary the owner and she did a great job of making us feel at home and that our business was appreciated. We can tell you that the chili, coneys and hot dogs were very good. I'll stop here again during future business trips!

data.title: "Family Run by nice people"
data.text: Stopped for a quick lunch, first time there.  We had a Chicago Dog and a Cheeseburger.  The burgers are not really a burger, they are loose ground beef, kind of like a sloppy joe, but without the red sauce or gravy. Both sandwiches came with fries. It is a small diner type place, but family run and the people were nice. Looks like a lot of locals come by.  Food was good, but the prices were a bit high for this type of place.

data.title: Loose meat can't be beat!
data.text: Great hamburger, hot dogs, loose meat sandwiches,  and they have a taco dog! This place is small but packs a big punch.

data.title: Love the scrambled hamburger
data.text: Love this diner, fast, friendly and great food.  Their hamburgers are better than the old Maid Rite but are similar since they are steamed and scramble.  Wonderful and generous amount of fries are included with the hot dogs and many other sandwiches which are also great.

data.title: Good Food and great "old school" service.
data.text: From the outside this place looks like any other south side hot dog place.   Go inside for a family run diner that is spotlessly clean and with waitress or counter service that makes sure you are appreciated.  I love going here for their genuinely friendly service and a reasonable meal.  A real gem.

data.title: BEST DOG HOUSE
data.text: I love their polish sausage. I'm thinking about getting one now. They have loose burgers, hot dogs, chili dogs, pizza puffs, corn dogs. I love this place.

data.title: Best Hotdogs in Hammond / Chicago
data.text: Been going for 20+ years.  Everything is great.  I recently had the tacos, they were great.  Highly recommend the hotdogs

data.title: This is a staple of Hammond, and it's for a good reason!  It has excellent loose-meat cheeseburgers, polish sausages...
data.text: This is a staple of Hammond, and it's for a good reason!  It has excellent loose-meat cheeseburgers, polish sausages, and hotdogs!
